inputs.name: torqueEndpoint
inputs.label: Service Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: This is the name of the connection that you entered when you created the "Torque service connection" during the plugin configuration.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the timeout for this step (in minutes), if your sandbox will not be ready when the timeout is reached, Torque will abort the deployment.

inputs.name: space
inputs.label: Space name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a name for your Torque space.

inputs.name: blueprint
inputs.label: Blueprint name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the name of the blueprint you would like to use for creating this sandbox. NOTE: To specify one of Torqueâ€™s sample blueprints, use a [sample] prefix, i.e: [sample]Java Spring.

inputs.name: sandbox
inputs.label: Sandbox name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a name for the sandbox.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.label: Inputs
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this blueprint has inputs, you may specify them in a comma/semi-comma/newline separated list of input names and their values. e.g., input1 name=value1, input2 name=value2

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set the duration (in minutes), after which Torque will stop the deployment. if omitted no duration is set.

outputVariables.name: Sandbox_Details
outputVariables.description: All the sandbox details including instances' IP addresses, ports and other infrastructure details required to properly run your tests. You may query this parameter to get the required information.

outputVariables.name: Sandbox_Id
outputVariables.description: The identifier of the created sandbox. You will use this identifier to end your sandbox when needed.
